<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Bulk delete tickets"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"delete"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/tickets/bulk/delete"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Soft-deletes multiple tickets in a single bulk operation. Deleted tickets are marked with `IsDeleted: true` but remain in the database and can be restored by administrators.

**Prerequisites**
1. **TicketIds** – Use [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) to find tickets and collect `Items[].TicketId` values.

**Workflow Example**
1. Search tickets: [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) with criteria → collect `TicketId` array
2. Review: Confirm tickets should be deleted (consider export or archiving first)
3. Bulk delete: [DELETE /api/v1.0/tickets/bulk/delete](/docs/api/tickets/bulk-delete-tickets) with ticket IDs
4. Verify: [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) with standard filters – deleted tickets no longer appear

**Request Body**: Provide `TicketIds` array.

**Restoration**: Administrators can restore deleted tickets using [PUT /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}/undelete](/docs/api/tickets/undelete-ticket) or by searching with `OnlyShowDeleted: true` filter.

**Note**: This is a soft delete. For compliance or data retention, tickets remain queryable with the `OnlyShowDeleted` filter.

**Related Endpoints**
- [PUT /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}/undelete](/docs/api/tickets/undelete-ticket) – Restore single ticket
- [POST /api/v1.0/tickets/bulk/assign](/docs/api/tickets/bulk-assign-tickets) – Bulk assign instead

Obtain via [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets), extract `Items[].TicketId`.","x-obtained-from":{"operationId":"searchTickets","endpoint":"POST /api/v1.0/tickets","responseField":"Items[].TicketId"}}}}},"required":["TicketIds"],"example":{"TicketIds":["260b8773-dcad-f011-8e61-000d3a7bb518","370c9884-edbe-f011-9f72-111e4a8cc629"]},"title":"BulkDeleteTicketsRequest"}}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
